vision.notes: Deep-sea fish. At least some species have evolved features for camouflage in dimly lit environments, such as highly light-absorbent skin due to melanophores packed with melanin. It is inferred vision is present, but potentially adapted for low-light conditions.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely present, enabling detection of water displacement and pressure changes. Essential for prey detection and predator avoidance in deep-sea environments.

chemoreception.notes: Likely present, facilitating detection of chemical cues for prey location and mate recognition in the deep sea.
